quest.name: The Secret of the Twelve
journal: Deryk casts a languid gaze to and fro.

Having extracted the information from her final stone, Krile rejoins you in Quarrymill. She expresses her thanks to her companions, mortal and divine alike, and together you make your way back to the Omphalos.

You arrive in the Omphalos to find G'raha Tia and Snoegeim already returned from their respective pilgrimages. After the gods take their leave, you use the information you acquired to complete the monument's epigraph. Appearing to be written by the gods themselves, it explains that they were brought forth by the will of the star, before going on to describe the duties of each deity. The revelations have given you and your companions much to ponder, and you all sink into contemplative silence.

G'raha Tia posits that the gods created the epigraph so that they might never lose sight of their duty, no matter how much their nature might be altered over millennia. And Krile, identifying the will of the star as Hydaelyn, turns her attention to the watcher on the moon, who could well be the thirteenth unnamed being.

As it stands, you have yet to encounter three of the Twelve, and there is no telling what may happen once you have fought them all. In order to determine how best to proceed, Krile and G'raha Tia decide to return to Sharlayan to compile your findings. Deryk also excuses himself and heads out of the Omphalos, but Snoegeim bids you follow after the aloof explorer, unsettled by his melancholy musings.

In response to Snoegeim's fears that he might suddenly vanish, Deryk philosophizes that all things must come to an end. Saddened though he will be when the time comes to part ways, he accepts that sadness as part of the joy he has derived from your companionship, and declares his intention to strive with you to the last. Inspired by his words, you inwardly pledge to follow the mystery of the Twelve to its very end.
objectives: Speak with Deryk outside Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: HALONE
dialogue.text: In this land, those voices raised in praise for Nophica are especially strong.

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: Nophica and Byregot are also kind, are they not?

dialogue.name: BABYOPOOPO
dialogue.text: Ook, ook!

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: It doesn't take too long to extract the information. Krile should be here any moment now.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Apologies for the wait. With that, I've obtained information from all of my stones.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: You've taken care of yours already, yes?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Thank you for worrying about me. While it's good to know that I can handle myself, I'm heartened to be doing this with you all.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I owe you thanks as well, Byregot and Nophica, for accepting my request with good grace.

dialogue.name: BYREGOT
dialogue.text: Think naught of it. You did well to see your task through, little one.

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: Indeed. Come, come, let us all return to the Omphalos.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: You took your time, Forename. Did something happen?

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: Ah, so you rendezvoused with Krile. How was your experience with the gods, if I may ask?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Not only did you help a disillusioned man find his way, you looked in on Krile besides...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. And you as well, Deryk.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: ...I fear I overstepped my bounds, but what's done is done.

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: We shall return to our sanctums. You have our gratitude for the delightful time!

dialogue.name: NYMEIA
dialogue.text: By holding your instruments out to the monument, you will be able to augment the missing information. Be well, dear children.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Shall we, then?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Amazing! What was impossible to decipher is now crystal clear!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Without further ado, I shall read out the epigraph...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: (-Omphalos Monument-)As beings who endure by the will of the star, we are susceptible to the influence of hopes and prayers. Thus do we commit our yokes herein, lest we stray from our purpose.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: (-Omphalos Monument-)He who is named Byregot shall preside over construction. His duty: to fortify the works of men, and encourage them to build.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: (-Omphalos Monument-)He who is named Rhalgr shall preside over destruction. His duty: to galvanize the star's beating heart, and facilitate mankind's regeneration.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: (-Omphalos Monument-)She who is named Azeyma shall preside over the sun. Her duty: to nurture its life-giving light, and illuminate the truth for all to see.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: (-Omphalos Monument-)He who is named Nald'thal shall preside over the subterrane. His duty: to make gleam the riches hidden in the darkest depths─and in men themselves.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: (-Omphalos Monument-)She who is named Nophica shall preside over fertility. Her duty: to fill the land with life, and prepare a path of peace and plenty.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: (-Omphalos Monument-)He who is named Althyk shall preside over space and time. His duty: to endow the star with material vigor, that mankind's march may never cease.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: (-Omphalos Monument-)She who is named Halone shall preside over the glaciers. Her duty: to hold the melting ice at bay, and imbue men with constancy and tranquility.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: (-Omphalos Monument-)She who is named Menphina shall preside over the moon. Her duty: to perpetuate the turning of night and day, and foster love in the hearts of all.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: (-Omphalos Monument-)He who is named Thaliak shall preside over the rivers. His duty: to quench the thirst of men, and water their minds with wisdom.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: (-Omphalos Monument-)She who is named Nymeia shall preside over the stars. Her duty: to preserve the celestial fabric of the seasons, and weave the threads of men's lives.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: (-Omphalos Monument-)She who is named Llymlaen shall preside over the seas. Her duty: to administer the tides, and inspire men to come together as one and seek new horizons.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: (-Omphalos Monument-)He who is named Oschon shall preside over the mountains. His duty: to sustain the breath of the firmament, and in wandering share in men's solitude.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: (-Omphalos Monument-)He who is unnamed shall watch unflinching. His duty: to stand guard over his charge, always and unto the end.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: There the epigraph concludes. We've been given quite a lot to ponder...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Our yokes...lest we stray...

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Curiouser and curiouser...

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: Writings about the gods, written by the gods themselves... This is utterly unprecedented!

dialogue.name: BABYOPOOPO
dialogue.text: Ook? Ook?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Hopes and prayers influencing their nature...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Have you any thoughts on the contents of the epigraph, Forename?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: The prayers of her faithful made Halone more imposing.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: The worship of Dalamud brought forth Menphina's hound.

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: You mean to say that prayers have changed the Twelve into their present forms? That is rather hard to believe...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Given what we now know of dynamis, I believe it is entirely possible. In the presence of that energy, hopes and prayers have more tangible results than one might expect.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Its power may be curbed upon our star, but over thousands of years of worship, it could have influenced the gods in various ways.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Ways such as that which Forename just described, for one. Others that come to mind are Halone's shield and spear, which reflect her status as a goddess of war, and Nymeia's spinning wheel, which is an apt apparatus for a goddess of fate.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Thus did they create this monument─this yoke─that they might never lose sight of their duty, no matter how much they may change.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I'm inclined to agree with Raha.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: The gods wrote that they endure by “the will of the star.”

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Who that refers to, we all know too well.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Hydaelyn.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: By sundering reality, She must have known that She would shake the very foundation of existence. Anticipating the potential chaos, I suspect She charged Her collaborators with maintaining stability.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: If this is true, then might not the thirteenth unnamed being be the watcher on the moon?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: The pieces certainly fall into place. I wonder if he would be willing to share what he knows...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: As it stands, we've yet to encounter three gods. As there's no telling what may happen once we've fought them all, I believe we should try to uncover as much of the truth as we can, the better to know how to proceed.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: To that end, ere we seek out the watcher, Raha and I shall return to Sharlayan to compile our findings─the data from the analyzer not least of all.

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: To think that the investigation might lead us to the moon! I eagerly look forward to the next stage of our fieldwork!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Forename. Like as not, yet more grueling encounters with the gods await. You should rest up and gather your strength.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Not long now ere we arrive at the truth...

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: For the longest time I've journeyed alone, not involving myself in the affairs of others.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: But I've enjoyed our time together. You've undertaken the investigation with all earnestness, and it has been a pleasure to be part of it.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: When I imagine the moment we must part ways, I can't help but be saddened. And it surprises me that I feel that way.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: ...Forgive me, I didn't mean to wax sentimental. If you'll excuse me, I shall head outside for some fresh air.

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: There he goes again... Forename─do you suppose you could follow after him?

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: I can't quite say why, but I feel as though he'll suddenly vanish one day, never to return...

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Oh, 'tis you, Forename. What is it?

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Snoegeim's worried that I'll suddenly vanish, you say...

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Well, as the saying goes, all things must come to an end. Whether we will it or no.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: When our work is finished, we must go our separate ways.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Doing so will sadden me, as you know.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Yet that sadness is part of the joy I have derived from our companionship.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: So I will accept it when the time comes, and strive with you to the last.

dialogue.name: BABYOPOOPO
dialogue.text: Ook...?

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: As you know, my friend, I would rather you live your own life. But having helped you, I won't send you away against your will.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: ...Well, you are a busy womanman, so I won't keep you.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: As before, rest assured I will share with you any tidings I receive from Krile. Take care, my friend, and see you again in due course.
